
<<<Analysis>>>
The variable n is initialized to -9.
The code checks if n is 0. If it is, it prints 0 and exits.
The code then iterates from 0 to 49, meaning it will consider numbers from 0 to 255.
For each number i in this range, it checks if n is divisible by 2**i. If it is, it subtracts 2**i from n and appends a 0 to the string ans.
If n is not divisible by 2**i, it subtracts (-2)**i from n and appends a 1 to the string ans.
The code breaks the loop when n is 0.
The code then checks if the first character of ans is 0. If it is, it prints ans. Otherwise, it prints ans[1:].
